1: To you I lift up my eyes, to you who are seated in heaven.
2: Indeed, as the eyes of slaves look to the hand of their master, as the eyes of a maid look to the hand of her mistress, so our eyes look to the Lord our God, until he shows us his grace.
3: Show grace to us, O Lord. Show grace to us, for we have had our fill of contempt.
4: Our souls have had their fill of the scorn of the smug and of the contempt of the arrogant.
